docs.title: Home
docs.text:
MeTTa MeTTa programming language Training Portal

Comprehensive Curriculum

From functional foundations to advanced Neurosymbolic AI architectures using MeTTa and Hyperon.

Dual Tracks

Choose between the 4-month standard immersion or the 2-month fast-track for experienced developers.

Community Driven

Open access materials with a competitive, merit-based selection process for active cohort spots.

Certification

Earn recognition by delivering a functional capstone project using MORK and Atomspace.

Training Overview

Welcome to the Beyond the Code (India Program). This portal contains all necessary information regarding curriculum, scheduling, and certification requirements.

Training Tracks

This program is conducted via two distinct tracks. Please review the requirements for each track below.

  1. Normal Track (4 Months)

This track covers the comprehensive curriculum from foundational functional programming to advanced cognitive architectures.

Access: Online tutorials, training materials, and meeting recordings are open to the entire community.

Requirement: Trainees must propose a team project one month prior to the conclusion of the training.

Certification: Successful completion of the proposed project is required to be certified.

  1. Fast Track (2 Months)

Designed for individuals who have independently studied the provided materials and possess a strong grasp of the core concepts.

Selection Process: Candidates must pass a preliminary team hacking session to demonstrate proficiency.

Structure: Includes a rapid revision of core concepts followed by an intensive project phase.

Requirement: Trainees form teams after the first month to begin work on the capstone project.

Attendance & Retention Policy

We maintain high standards for participation to ensure the quality of the cohort.

Mandatory Attendance

Attendance is required for all sessions. Any trainee with more than three absences will be removed from the active training cohort.

Community Replacement Mechanism

Open spots resulting from trainee removal will be filled by members of the wider community on a monthly basis.

Selection Method: Candidates are selected via MeTTa coding challenges based on content covered to date.

Criteria: Nominations are awarded to the fastest correct submissions, subject to available capacity.

docs.title: Projects & Certification
docs.text: Completion of the training program is contingent upon the successful delivery of a capstone project.

docs.title: Team Structure
docs.text: Projects are to be executed in teams. We encourage diverse skill sets within each team to handle logic, integration, and architecture.

docs.title: Normal Track Timeline
docs.text:
• Proposal: Teams must submit a project proposal one month before the training concludes.
  • Scope: Projects must utilize concepts covered in the curriculum (MeTTa, Atomspace).
  • Evaluation: Projects will be presented during the final sessions (Sessions 52-56).

docs.title: Fast Track Timeline
docs.text:
• Formation: Teams are formed immediately following the first month of the fast track.
  • Execution: Teams have one month to execute and deliver the project.

docs.title: Certification Criteria
docs.text:
Certificates are awarded based on:

  1. Technical Implementation: Correct usage of MeTTa and MORK.
  2. Attendance: Adherence to the attendance policy (< 3 absences).
  3. Project Delivery: Successful presentation and functionality of the final build.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: Reference materials to support your learning journey.

docs.title: Setup & Basics
docs.text:
• MeTTa Setup Tutorial
  • Official MeTTa Documentation
  • Additional MeTTa Documentation

docs.title: Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Knowledge Representation using MeTTa
  • Working with Spaces
  • Python Integration using MeTTa

docs.title: Curriculum & Session Log
docs.text: This schedule outlines the progression of topics. Sessions are numbered sequentially.

docs.title: Module 1: Foundations of MeTTa
docs.text: Focus: Syntax, Functional Programming, and Data Types.

docs.title: Session 03: MeTTa Basics (Part I)
docs.text:
• Environment setup.
  • Basic syntax structure.
  • Built-in data types.
  • Variables and function definitions.

docs.title: Session 05: Atomspace Fundamentals
docs.text:
• Introduction to Atomspace concepts.
  • Pattern matching logic.
  • Revisiting functions/bindings with pattern matching.

docs.title: Session 10: Data Structures
docs.text:
• Types and constructors.
  • Lists, Trees, Sets, and Maps.

docs.title: Session 12: Revision
docs.text: • Practical review of concepts covered to date.

docs.title: Module 4: Integration & MORK
docs.text: Focus: Python Integration, Debugging, and the MORK Engine.

docs.title: Session 24: Debugging (I)
docs.text:
• Milestone: Team formation and project initiation.
  • Debugging techniques.

docs.title: Module 6: Cognitive Architectures & Conclusion
docs.text: Focus: Hyperon, Neurosymbolic AI, and Final Review.

docs.title: Session 54: Revision
docs.text: • Technical review of concepts (up to Python integration).
